net.sf.jclal.util.random

Interface IRandGen

  • All Superinterfaces:
    JCLAL, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractRandGen, JavaRandom, Ranecu, Ranlux, Ranmar, Ranmt

    public interface IRandGen
extends JCLAL
    Root for the random hierarchy.
    Author:
    Sebastian Ventura

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int choose(int hi)
      Return an integer random value in the range [1, ...hi)
      int choose(int lo, int hi)
      Return an integer random value in the range [lo, ...hi)
      boolean coin()
      Return a boolean that's true 0.5 of the time.
      boolean coin(double p)
      Return a boolean that's true p of the time.
      double gaussian()
      Uses the Box-Muller algorithm to transform raw's into gaussian deviates.
      double gaussian(double sd)
      Return a gaussian distributed random real value with standard deviation "sd".
      double powlaw(double alpha, double cut)
      Generate a "power-law distribution" with exponent "alpha" and lower cutoff "cut".
      double raw()
      Return a double value in the range [0,1].
      void raw(double[] d)
      Fill an entire array with doubles.
      void raw(double[] d, int n)
      Fill part or all of an array with doubles.
      double uniform(double lo, double hi)
      Return a uniform random real in the range [lo, hi].

    • Method Detail

      • raw

        double raw()
        Return a double value in the range [0,1]. This method will be defined to make a working IRandGen.
        Returns:
        a random double in the range [0,1]

      • raw

        void raw(double[] d,
         int n)
        Fill part or all of an array with doubles.
        Parameters:
        d - array to be filled with doubles.
        n - number of doubles to generate.

      • raw

        void raw(double[] d)
        Fill an entire array with doubles.
        Parameters:
        d - array to be filled with doubles.

      • choose

        int choose(int hi)
        Return an integer random value in the range [1, ...hi)
        Parameters:
        hi - upper limit of range.
        Returns:
        a random integer in the range.

      • choose

        int choose(int lo,
           int hi)
        Return an integer random value in the range [lo, ...hi)
        Parameters:
        lo - lower limit of range
        hi - upper limit of range
        Returns:
        a random integer in the range.

      • coin

        boolean coin()
        Return a boolean that's true 0.5 of the time. This method call is equivalent to coin(0.5).
        Returns:
        a boolean that's true 0.5 of the time.

      • coin

        boolean coin(double p)
        Return a boolean that's true p of the time.
        Parameters:
        p - probability that function will return true.
        Returns:
        a boolean that's true p of the time.

      • uniform

        double uniform(double lo,
               double hi)
        Return a uniform random real in the range [lo, hi].
        Parameters:
        lo - lower limit of range.
        hi - upper limit of range.
        Returns:
        a uniform random real in the range.

      • gaussian

        double gaussian()
        Uses the Box-Muller algorithm to transform raw's into gaussian deviates.
        Returns:
        a random real with a gaussian distribution and unitary standard deviation.

      • gaussian

        double gaussian(double sd)
        Return a gaussian distributed random real value with standard deviation "sd".
        Parameters:
        sd - standard deviation.
        Returns:
        a random real with gaussian distribution and standard deviation sd.

      • powlaw

        double powlaw(double alpha,
              double cut)
        Generate a "power-law distribution" with exponent "alpha" and lower cutoff "cut".
        Parameters:
        alpha - the exponent.
        cut - the lower cutoff.
        Returns:
        random
